parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From kata and luo; to loosen down, i.e. to demolish; specially to halt for the night.
Done or made with hands, artificial. From cheir and a derivative of poieo; manufactured, i.e. Of human construction.
A temple, a shrine, that part of the temple where God himself resides. From a primary naio; a fane, shrine, temple.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Three. Or neuter tria a primary number; 'three'.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From the same as oikodome; to be a house-builder, i.e. Construct or confirm.
Other, another (of more than two), different. A primary word; 'else, ' i.e. Different.
Not made with hands. Unmanufactured, i.e. Inartificial.
